info.game_comments:
2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 41.

(Cheryl: We'll find out how New York's finest got and stay that way.  Clues from the NYPD, next on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from outside an NYPD station.)  In a 1975 movie, the NYPD sent Popeye Doyle to this country; today it sends detectives to Interpol HQ there

(4, 1).clue: Get lost in Hampton Court Palace's one of these, formed by clipped hedges, that dates back to the 17th c.

(5, 1).clue: There's the signpost up ahead... it says "He was a WWII paratrooper, a boxer & a 1960 Emmy winner"; your next stop: him

(6, 1).clue: Take this letter, wrap it in towel, & it becomes a masonry tool

(1, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from an NYPD station.)  A Level C Tyvek suit is used by this NYPD unit that's named for the material they're dispatched to work around

(3, 2).clue: The Museum of Flight at Boeing Field,The Pacific Science Center

(4, 2).clue: In the 1800s city founders designed Macon, Georgia to look like this ancient city known for its gardens

(5, 2).clue: This construction worker seen here was in the news in 1991

(6, 2).clue: It turns the Greek letter lambda into a sexy dance

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from outside an NYPD station.)  On the narrow streets of Lower Manhattan police drive Piaggios, from the makers of this Italian scooter that debuted in 1946

(3, 3).clue: The Joe Louis Fist,The Dossin Great Lakes Museum

(4, 3).clue: The "Cinnamon Gardens" are among the most fashionable neighborhoods in this Sri Lankan capital city

(5, 3).clue: It may be shocking to know you can act as one of these to divert attention from other targets of inquiry

(6, 3).clue: When this letter is added to flame it becomes a flaming dessert

(1, 4).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from inside a NYPD station.)  The NYPD's offical motto, fidelis ad mortem, means this--it recognizes officers who sacrified for fellow citizens

(3, 4).clue: Audubon Park,Jean Lafitte National Historic Park

(4, 4).clue: Shakespeare said these conflicts, appropriately, began in the Middle Temple Gardens of the Inns of Court

(5, 4).clue: The 1967 book "Listen to the Warm" featured song lyrics by this American poet

(6, 4).clue: Add this letter to cafe & you get a word meaning to irritate by rubbing

(1, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from outside an NYPD station.)  The NYPD bomb squad robot was made by this military corporation that also developed the Stealth bomber

(4, 5).clue: After a little financial trouble in 2003, these famous "Gardens" in Winter Haven, Florida are now back in business

(5, 5).clue: Entombing his still-living sister Madeline, always a social faux pas, wasn't this Poe boy's best move

(6, 5).clue: This letter turns the classic movie "Gigi" into a less than classic 2003 film

(1, 1).clue: Morose character whose first line is "A little more than kin, and less than kind"

(2, 1).clue: The rounded part of a racquet, or a racquet brand used by Ashe & Agassi

(5, 1).clue: During World War I, this city leased the area from the feds for use as a park

(6, 1).clue: This state's official marine mammal is the bowhead whale, which inhabits Arctic waters

(1, 2).clue: Shakespeare puns on his own name in the sonnet opening "Whoever hath her wish, thou hast thy" this

(2, 2).clue: Famous for tires, the name whose symbol is seen here can also be found on tennis gear

(3, 2).clue: In the late 1890s many rushed to this golden region

(4, 2).clue: 1990s:"You might be a redneck if your family tree does not fork"

(5, 2).clue: In the Civil War it was the fort's function, not just for soldiers but for newspaper editors & other troublesome types

(6, 2).clue: In 1996 Keiko the whale was sent from Mexico City to Newport, Oregon via this parcel company

(1, 3).clue: The wounded Mercutio says, "You shall find me" this type of "man", & he doesn't just mean "serious"

(2, 3).clue: Gamma makes these by altering the molecular structure of a co-polymer; so much for good old gut

(3, 3).clue: In all probability, it's the degree of probability

(5, 3).clue: After commanding the fleet bombing the fort, George Cockburn's next big job was bringing Napoleon here

(6, 3).clue: Whoa!  Reaching 80 feet or more in length, the finback whale is second in size only to this one

(1, 4).clue: Punning 3-word completion of "Now is the winter of our discontent made glorious summer by this..."

(2, 4).clue: This classic Adidas shoe is named for the 1971 U.S. Open men's singles champ

(4, 4).clue: 1950s:"When I was born, my mother said, 'Get the doctor back.  He's taken the baby and left the stork'"

(5, 4).clue: The fort features a monument to Francis Scott Key, who's seen as this mythical musical maestro

(6, 4).clue: One of the 2 3-letter terms for a group of whales

(1, 5).clue: Think our puns are lame?  Look at the "on"/"one" business between Valentine & his servant in this comedy

(2, 5).clue: This brand supplies Venus & Serena's racquets & the official ball of AVP pro beach volleyball

(4, 5).clue: 1980s:"In America you can always find a party.  In Russia the party always finds you"

(5, 5).clue: A movie you can watch at the visitor center, it was also the original title of Francis Scott Key's poem

(6, 5).clue: Gray whales are an example of this toothless class of whales that also have 2 blowholes

(0, 0).clue: The appearance of this famous site gave England its old name of Albion
